p: The seeds of cultivated peanut, Arachis hypogaea, store proteins, lipids and starch required for energy and growth upon germination. The seed can be harvested to serve as human nutrition, stock feed and biofuels [ 1, 2, 3]. Peanuts and other legumes have the ability to fix nitrogen and thus increase the sustainability of agricultural systems [ 4]. The pressure for peanut seed as plant-based protein and oilseed source is increasing with a growing world population. Due to its agronomic importance, improvement of peanut seed performance is necessary to meet the demand.
